google-objc-avoid-throwing-exception.description:
Description

Finds uses of throwing exceptions usages in Objective-C files.

For the same reason as the Google C++ style guide, we prefer not throwing
exceptions from Objective-C code.

The corresponding C++ style guide rule:
https://google.github.io/styleguide/cppguide.html#Exceptions

Instead, prefer passing in
NSError
**
and return
BOOL
to indicate
success or failure.

A counterexample:

-
(
void
)
readFile
{
if
([
self
isError
])
{
@throw
[
NSException
exceptionWithName
:
...];
}
}

Instead, returning an error via
NSError
**
is preferred:

-
(
BOOL
)
readFileWithError:
(
NSError
**
)
error
{
if
([
self
isError
])
{
*
error
=
[
NSError
errorWithDomain
:
...];
return
NO
;
}
return
YES
;
}

The corresponding style guide rule:
https://google.github.io/styleguide/objcguide.html#avoid-throwing-exceptions
google-objc-avoid-throwing-exception.option:
Static analysis (Clang-Tidy) options are configured via .clang-tidy file.

This rule has no specific options.
